page.title: 07West Dean Gardens
page.content: Surrounding West Dean College are the Edwardian-style country-house gardens. Walking through them,you could almost be back in the nineteenth-century.The gardens are full of beautiful flowers and shrubs,and also some rare trees. The Garden is open to the Public and always has an abundance of visitors. The first garden was created in 1622, and after the adding of several large lawns,now occupies an area of thirty- five acres. The Orangery is a fine conservatory, which was built by James Wyatt. Nowadays,it is used as a refreshment area. The Walled Garden was built in 1810, replacing a smaller kitchen garden.It houses a lawnmower collection,dating back to the 1850's.There is also a garden exhibition,dating back to 1623.
